chapter.title: The Main Window
chapter.para: The main window is composed of several elements, explanations for which are below.

itemizedlist.listitem:
File->Run Valgrind:
This option will be disabled if a process is currently running.s
Selecting this option will run Valgrind on whatever executable is currently specified in the Options::Valkyrie::Binary option. If no executable has been set, a dialog will pop up asking you to enter the path/to/executable.
The "Run Valgrind" toolbutton is a shortcut to this menu option.

listitem.para: This option will be disabled unless a process is currently running.
Selecting this option will abort the current run.
Note: Not all processes can currently be stopped: for example loading/saving a logfile.
The "Stop" toolbutton is a shortcut to this menu option.
Selecting this will close the current ToolView. If the ToolView contains an unsaved file, or if a process is in the middle of being run, a dialog will pop up asking for confirmation.
Exits Valkyrie. If a process is in the middle of being run, or a ToolView contains unsaved data, a dialog will pop up asking for confirmation.
This menu shows which Valgrind tools are available. The currently selected tool is greyed out.
The "ToolView Buttons" at the bottom, just below the status message area, provide a quick way of switching between views. The currently selected ToolView button is depressed.

This menu contains links to a dialog where preferences, options and flags may be set for Valkyrie, Valgrind, and (supported) Valgrind tools. Any flag which may be given on the command-line for Valkyrie or Valgrind is available to be set in this dialog. Settings applied to the current run are only saved to disk if you select Options->Save As Default. Also see below.
For detailed information on this dialog, see the page.
You can access the HandBook at any time. It contains the manuals for both Valgrind and Valkyrie. See also below.
This is a small dialog with brief "about" information.

When clicked, the cursor will change its shape; then, clicking on any widget anywhere within Valkyrie will bring up the "Handbook" at the relevant page, providing instant help without having to trawl through the manual.
This is particularly useful for the box: Clicking on a option widget will take you directly to the relevant section of the manual.

sect1.title: Valgrind Control ToolBar
sect1.para: This toolbar simply holds shortcut buttons to the File->Run Valgrind, and File->Stop menu options.

sect1.title: ToolView ToolBar
sect1.para: Each ToolView has its own toolbar, giving various options for that Valgrind tool. See the appropriate tool`s section of the manual for information on its toolbars.

sect1.title: ToolViews
sect1.para: The current ToolView resides in the main central area. Each ToolView has its own specific window with different functionality. For example, MemcheckView provides a tree-view showing the parsed XML output of Valgrind.

sect1.title: Flags Widget
sect1.para: The flags widget shows the flags for the current Valgrind process. A button to open/close the flags widget is on the bottom right corner, with an icon of a flag.
Example: if valkyrie /bin/ls -lF was given on the command line, then this window would show:
Note: Valkyrie only displays and sends flags to Valgrind which are not the defaults.

sect1.title: Status Messages
sect1.para: Messages are displayed here, showing the current state of play.
